name: chicagotribune
text:
Research suggests airborne risk of contracting COVID-19 is highest in crowded indoor spaces with poor ventilation. That may help explain superspreading events in meatpacking plants, churches and restaurants.

Here's what else to know, via New York Times: https://t.co/Io19QVSwrf

name: chicagotribune
text: Janet Hayes, a former executive of Pottery Barn and Williams Sonoma, will take over as CEO of Crate & Barrel. https://t.co/3h5WiPhRC6

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: A lower COVID-19 death count is no justification for states to reopen their economies incautiously. https://t.co/VlcfG21IdZ

name: chicagotribune
text: Column: Umpire Joe West’s skepticism about the COVID-19 death count puts his judgment under fire before the MLB season even begins, writes @PWSullivan. https://t.co/lgOXLcd2Sp

name: chicagotribune
text: Nearly 23 years after losing his freedom, Antonio McDowell is on a new, if unlikely, path. Now, he is eager to put his past behind him and prove he was wrongfully convicted. https://t.co/zeumGvTHJN

name: chicagotribune
text: The Trump administration has formally notified the United Nations of its withdrawal from the World Health Organization, although the pullout won’t take effect until next year. https://t.co/YW3aUEALiy

name: chicagotribune
text: As Illinois eases restrictions on gatherings, some North Shore houses of worship are conducting modified in-person services again. https://t.co/dyAERtXfr9

name: chicagotribune
text: Some companies aren't allowing workers to wear Black Lives Matter masks or other BLM attire. Employees have protested against those decisions at Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s, Taco Bell and Starbucks, among others. https://t.co/WjU1bww94g

name: chicagotribune
text: What to stream: Consult this list when you need a delightful movie https://t.co/jndK8ZUulv

name: chicagotribune
text: The FBI is investigating the reported assault of a Black man by a group of white men at a southern Indiana lake. https://t.co/Fb7rucenCe

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: Illinois' broken tax system has badly eroded the ability of state agencies to combat threats to public health and the environment. https://t.co/E3HWZ8cSnE

name: chicagotribune
text: Supreme Court Justice John Roberts was hospitalized last month after a fall while walking for exercise that "was likely due to light-headedness caused by dehydration,” a court spokeswoman said. https://t.co/7ZAYD65uF1
